title: 10 Rejuvenating Yoga Retreats and Wellness...
text:
By Sharell Cook Updated May 19, 2016 . 
Whether you want to go on a yoga holiday, or study yoga more seriously, Goa is a popular place to do so. There are plenty of Goa yoga retreats to choose from. Most are located in north Goa and are generally open from October to May each year. Here's the pick of the bunch, offering everything from drop in classes to lengthier courses, for all budgets. Many focus on holistic wellness, and also provide Ayurvedic treatments and other natural therapies. Little Cove Yoga Holiday Retreat 1. Little Cove Yoga Holiday Retreat, Cola 
One of the most popular places for a yoga vacation in south Goa , Little Cove Yoga Holiday Retreat is located amid a palm grove on secluded Cola (not to be confused with Colva) beach near Agonda beach . Unlike most yoga retreats in Goa, this one is run by an Indian yogi who has a Diploma in Ashtanga Yoga and Naturopathy. Two yoga classes are offered each day on the beachfront. Organic vegetarian Indian meals (including vegan and gluten-free) are provided, and you can also take complimentary cooking classes. There are Ayurveda facilities on the premises too. For those interested in more intense yoga practice, various 10-15 day themed yoga retreats, led by world-renowned yoga teachers, are held throughout the year. Read reviews on Tripadvisor. Cost: Rates for yoga holidays (including meals, accommodations in deluxe bamboo beach cottages, and two yoga sessions a day) start from 4,200 rupees ($65) per person per day, twin share. Ayurvedic massages are available for 1,500 rupees per hour. 
continue reading below our video Best Road Trip Apps 2. Bamboo Yoga Retreat, Patnem 
Bamboo Yoga Retreat (formerly Lotus Yoga Retreat) has an idyllic location on south Goa's chilled-out Patnem beach , close to restaurants and shops. There are three dedicated yoga shalas , plus a separate spa area for massages and therapies. Both yoga holidays and more intensive yoga retreats are offered, with a range of flexible classes and styles for all levels. Accommodations are provided in eco-friendly beach huts with attached bathrooms. The extensive spa treatments on offer include reiki, massage, shiatsu, Ayurveda, and body scrubs. Read reviews on Tripadvisor. Cost: Rates vary, depending on the location of the hut, and start from about $65 per person per day, twin share. Accommodations, meditation and yoga, and healthy vegetarian breakfast and lunch are included.
